com.qubulus.qps
Class PositioningManager

java.lang.Object
  com.qubulus.qps.PositioningManager

public class PositioningManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides client-side access to the positioning service. Each client should have its own manager instance, but the positioning service will be shared across all clients in the process.

Version:
0

Field Detail

POSITION_REQ_INTERVAL

public static final int POSITION_REQ_INTERVAL
Suggested positioning request interval. You may use your own constant if your application has different requirements. May produce strange results < 2000ms.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

REQUEST_ACTION

public static final java.lang.String REQUEST_ACTION
Action that positioning service implementations must include in their intent filter. Note that you shall not use this intent action directly from your code; use requestPosition() and stopService() instead.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

get

public static PositioningManager get(Context context)
Retrieve an instance of the manager for the given context

requestPosition

public int requestPosition()
Request a position to the positioning service(s) implementation declared in AndroidManifest.xml (see REQUEST_ACTION). This method is asynchronous, and the answer will be delivered as a broadcast intent. You should typically expect a delay on the order of a second between a request and the corresponding answer. Note that several requests issued by one or many clients during that computation time will result in only one answer.

If the service handling request is not started (because this is a first request or it was explicitly shutdown previously via stopService()), it will be automatically restarted.

Returns:
the number of positioning service implementations that the request was forwarded to.

stopService

public void stopService()
Stop the service handling the position requests. This will free any memory used by the service, and remove any status bar notification (in case the wifi was off for example).

This should be called when the client is pretty confident that no further requests will be made in the near future, for example when closing a map activity.

Note that the service will be recreated on demand next time a position estimate is requested, but that comes with some overhead, so if latency is your priority, you should not call this method.

updateSite

public void updateSite(java.lang.String siteId)
Allows applications to switch site id in runtime. Setting site overrides the qps_site_id in RemotePositioningService

Parameters:
siteId - The ID of the site to switch to

updateMultifloorSettings

public void updateMultifloorSettings(int queueToleranceSeconds,
                                     int queueLength)
Allows applications to change floor switch filter queue size. Setting these values overrides the qps_switch_floor_queue_size and qps_switch_floor_queue_time_tollerance in RemotePositioningService

Parameters:
queueTolerance - Maximum time to consider a position for floor switching. Recommended < 30,000ms
queueLength - How many history positions you wish to consider. Recommended 3
